title: Push Pin Studio Typography
content: i'm doing a project focused on the use of typography by the Push Pin Studio since 1954 into the 1960's. Particularly how it stood out at the time and how the culture and historical context influenced it. Any suggestions or good resources i could use?
author: Hannarie jordaan

comments.content:
Here are three books that might be helpful:

[_The Push Pin Graphic: A Quarter Century of Innovative Design and Illustration_](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307084003/http:/www.amazon.com/Push-Pin-Graphic-Innovative-Illustration/dp/0811841030/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1215187618&sr=1-1)

[_Milton Glaser: Graphic Design_](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307084003/http:/www.amazon.com/Milton-Glaser-Graphic-Design/dp/0879511885/ref=pd_sim_b_2)

[_Seymour Chwast: The Left-Handed Designer_](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307084003/http:/www.amazon.com/Left-Handed-Designer-Seymour-Chwast/dp/0810912899/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1215187766&sr=1-1)
